{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3064286,"name":"Pepe Ga","username":"minecraftlov3r","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/d26b3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-05-22T03:52:30.061Z","cooked":"

It’s me. You’re favorite individual. I return with be(s)t(ter) GearBox. My last gearbox was perfect. This gearbox is well above that.

Requirements for Best GearBox 2:

  • 16 motors
  • be more expensive (expensive = better)
  • be better than best

This gearbox uses Neo 550 for more power and is stronger then cim.

Features:

  • Isogrid
  • Belts
  • GT2 pulleys (better than GT1)
  • Neo 550
  • Autocad
  • Innovation that Excites

smh I beat you to the joke over a year ago

Best GearBox

Dear Mr. Pepe Ga,

I believe you truly have a great start here, but this design can greatly benefit from usage of the BAG motor as you can have double the quantity per a robot. Usage of the bag motor along with the 20 port PDP previously mentioned in the thread and the previously mentioned one gearbox per a robot drive configuration will allow a whooping 40 motors for true field domination.

Best Regards,
Zander
